body_text:
Yeah, we can just dump the command into `aten/tools`. The current command,
which we can just put in a script and modify is:

```
rm -rf repo
git clone $EXTRACTED_REPO repo
cd repo
git config user.name "Zach DeVito"
git config user.email "zdevito@fb.com"
git remote add fullrepo $FULL_REPO
git fetch fullrepo
git checkout -b temporary-split-branch fullrepo/master
git filter-branch -f --subdirectory-filter $EXTRACTED_PATH --prune-empty
git checkout master
git merge temporary-split-branch
git push
```
…

body:
Yeah, we can just dump the command into `aten/tools`. The current command,
which we can just put in a script and modify is:

```
rm -rf repo
git clone $EXTRACTED_REPO repo
cd repo
git config user.name "Zach DeVito"
git config user.email "zdevito@fb.com"
git remote add fullrepo $FULL_REPO
git fetch fullrepo
git checkout -b temporary-split-branch fullrepo/master
git filter-branch -f --subdirectory-filter $EXTRACTED_PATH --prune-empty
git checkout master
git merge temporary-split-branch
git push
```

On Thu, Apr 12, 2018 at 4:33 PM, Edward Z. Yang <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> That SGTM. We might have to modify the filter, so if it can live in a file
> somewhere that would be helpful.
